Uses of Class
io.smudgr.engine.alg.op.Operation

  • Packages that use Operation 
    Package Description
    io.smudgr.app  
    io.smudgr.engine.alg.op  
    io.smudgr.test  

    • Uses of Operation in io.smudgr.app

      Methods in io.smudgr.app with parameters of type Operation 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Algorithm smudgr.getOperationAlgorithm(Rack rack, Operation op)
      Get a new algorithm wrapping the given operation

    • Uses of Operation in io.smudgr.engine.alg.op

      Subclasses of Operation in io.smudgr.engine.alg.op 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ChannelBleed
      Channel Bleed rotates colors using a bitwise function for a weird digi-acid effect.
      class  ChannelCrush
      Channel Crush uses a configurable bitwise function to squash RGB layer information, resulting in a image with a singular color palette and bolder forms, at the price of texture detail.
      class  ChannelDrift
      Channel Drift shifts image RGB layers separately by parameterized amounts.
      class  ChannelSort
      ChannelSort sorts pixels but on a masked portion of the pixel.
      class  DataBend
      Data Bend mimics the popular Wordpad effect, with a configurable 'Target' byte to replace a set 'Amount' of times.
      class  HSVLModifier
      HSV/L Modifier provides a traditional manipulation for saturation, hue, and brightness.
      class  Marbeler
      Marbeler iteratively shifts pixel columns in alternating directions for a marble-esque distortion.
      class  ParallelOperation
      The abstract ParallelOperation class allows implementors to easily execute an operation in parallel across each pixel index list.
      class  ParticlePush
      Particle Push takes pixels and displaces them by a univariate scaled shift amount.
      class  PixelShift
      Pixel Shift simply shifts pixels by a given amount, within interval offsets, along the current Algorithm selected pixel sets.
      class  PixelSort
      Pixel Sort, as implied by its name, sorts pixels in forward or reverse order using the value of each pixel as calculated by a configurable function.
      class  RainbowBend
      I actually have no idea what this does.
      class  Smear
      I honestly haven't played with this so who knows
      class  SourceMixer
      Source Mixer allows the traditional blending of two images, one being the passed in Frame and another being a configurable Source
      class  SpectralShift
      Spectral Shift buckets pixels using their value as calculated by a function, and replaces each pixel in that bucket with a distinct color.
